channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ZOOKEEPER-1771] ZooInspector authentication
item.description:
ZooInspector doesn't support authentication, so it always connects as anonymous to the ensemble.
It would be nice to be able to configure the authentication scheme+data in order to browse the nodes that have ACLs set.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Proposal: Have 2 extra fields for:

  • auth scheme
  • auth data
    They would be passed along to the zookeeper client:
    zooKeeper.addAuthInfo(scheme, data);
Patch for the described proposal, should it be accepted I can provide a patch for 3.4 too.

This patch only affects the connection popup of ZooInspector. 2 fields are added: "Authentication Scheme" and "Authentication Data".
You can leave it blank for an Anonymous connection (old behavior), or enter some authentication to be able to browse nodes that have ACLs set.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12606261/ZOOKEEPER-1771.patch
against trunk revision 1528586.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed core unit tests.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1629//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1629//artifact/trunk/build/test/findbugs/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1629//console

This message is automatically generated.
I would like to apply a patch in 3.4 as well. My apologies, I should have attached it earlier along with the patch for trunk.

Adds 2 fields in the connection window for authentication scheme and authentication data.
This patch also removes the licensing comments in the .cfg files where the viewers and the connection info are saved to match trunk. Such comments are not supported by the parser which produces an error at startup and prevents from viewing the node data/acls/metadata.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12606714/ZOOKEEPER-1771-3.4.patch
against trunk revision 1529013.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1637//console

This message is automatically generated.

SUCCESS: Integrated in ZooKeeper-trunk #2078 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/ZooKeeper-trunk/2078/)
ZOOKEEPER-1771. ZooInspector authentication (Benjamin Jaton via phunt) (phunt: http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1528928)

  • /zookeeper/trunk/CHANGES.txt
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/contrib/zooinspector/config/defaultConnectionSettings.cfg
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/contrib/zooinspector/src/java/org/apache/zookeeper/inspector/manager/ZooInspectorManagerImpl.java
Fixing in 3.4 is fine, however the supplied patch is removing the license headers from some files, that needs to be fixed/resubmitted. Thanks Benjamin!
Indeed the patch removes some license headers, but that was what had been already done in the trunk to make ZooInspector work.

Ah! Interesting. I looked at the trunk patch for 1771 and didn't see that change there so assumed the headers still existed in trunk versions of the files. I see that's not the case.

We need to fix this - we need to include the boilerplate license headers in those two cfg files for proper attribution. I don't see why it was removed in ZOOKEEPER-756.

Benjamin can you submit an updated 3.4 patch and a new trunk patch to address this? (unless I'm missing something) Thanks!
New patch for 3.4 to add authentication capabilities to ZooInspector and to support the license header in the conf file.
New patch for trunk to restore the license headers in the cfg files.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12607309/ZOOKEEPER-1771-trunk.patch
against trunk revision 1530110.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.
